response:
MRI is the gold standard to demonstrate dissemination in space and time and to rule out structural lesions. Lumbar puncture and specific serology are required to confirm inflammatory demyelination and exclude mimics like NMOSD, infection, or systemic autoimmunity.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Whole Spine with Gadolinium contrast", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Thyroid function tests", "Serum Vitamin B12", "Serum Folate", "Serum Aquaporin-4 (AQP4) antibodies", "Serum Myelin Oligodendrocyte Glycoprotein (MOG) antibodies", "Antinuclear antibody (ANA) panel", "Extractable nuclear antigen (ENA) panel", "Syphilis serology", "Lyme disease serology", "Serum Angiotensin Converting Enzyme (ACE)", "Lumbar puncture for CSF analysis (Microscopy, Culture, Glucose, Protein, Oligoclonal Bands)"]
